com.sri.kernel
Class Diagnostics

java.lang.Object
  com.sri.kernel.Diagnostics
public class Diagnostics
extends java.lang.Object

A class to manage module diagnostics. Can preform diagnostics on a single module or all loaded modules. Diagnostics are implemented in levels specified by the DIAG_ constants DIAG_FULL, DIAG_CONFIG, DIAG_DEFAULT, and DIAG_BASIC.

Each constant has a specific purpose and should be implemented accordingly by the module.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots

Field Detail

DIAG_FULL

public static final int DIAG_FULL
Full diagnostic. The most time consuming and interactive. Used to get as much information as possible.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DIAG_CONFIG

public static final int DIAG_CONFIG
Diagnostic used to configure a component. Can be used for a self-configuration, or for the user to extract readings.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DIAG_DEFAULT

public static final int DIAG_DEFAULT
The default diagnostic. Should be used to perform a moderate level of diagnostic, and is aimed at user level diagnostic

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DIAG_BASIC

public static final int DIAG_BASIC
A quick diagnostic to be the least intrusive and time consuming. Is done at boot time.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

setPrintStream

public void setPrintStream(java.io.PrintStream ps)
Sets the secondary print stream for the diagnostic print stream.

Parameters:
ps - A PrintStream object used to report actions back to the calling method during a diagnostic.

public java.io.PrintStream getPrintStream(java.io.PrintStream ps)

Returns:
The secondary print stream used during diagnostics.

diagnoseModule

public boolean diagnoseModule(java.lang.String moduleName)
Performs diagnostic on [moduleName] using the level DIAG_DEFAULT. Equivilent of calling diagnoseModule(modules.getModuleInfo(moduleName), DIAG_DEFAULT);

Parameters:
moduleName - The name of the module to diagnose.
Returns:
True if diagnostics passed, false if failed.

level - The level at which to diagnose from the DIAG_ constants.
Returns:

diagnoseModule

public boolean diagnoseModule(ModuleInfo mi,
                              int level)
Performs diagnostic on Module Info [mi] using the level [level] Equivilent of calling diagnoseModule(mi.getModuleName(), mi.getModule(), level);

Parameters:
mi - The ModuleInfo object representing the module.
level - The level at which to diagnose from the DIAG_ constants.
Returns:
True if diagnostics passed, false if failed.

diagnoseModule

public boolean diagnoseModule(java.lang.String moduleName,
                              Module module,
                              int level)
Performs diagnostic on the module [module] named by the string [moduleName] at the level [level]. This method performs the actual diagnostic on the module, logging any actions using the diagnostic print stream.

Parameters:
moduleName - The name of the module to diagnose.
module - The Module to perform the diagnostic.
level - The level at which to diagnose from the DIAG_ constants.
Returns:
True if diagnostics passed, false if failed.

diagnose

public boolean diagnose()
Performs a diagnostic on all loaded modules using the level DIAG_DEFAULT.

Returns:
True if diagnostics passed, false if failed.

Returns the string representation of the [level] represented by the DIAG_ constants.

Parameters:
level - The level to convert to a string as specified by the DIAG_ constants.
Returns:
The string representation of [level].
